review: In general, this is awesome, but the pictures of it just being a fob are misleading. There's a plug-in cord to it. Doesn't make it work less or anything, was just surprised to find that in the package.
author: lesomers

review: I have a Chromecast on every TV in my house (7 in all). It is such a low priced and versatile device that only gets better. This week Google updated the firmware to allow you to control your Chromecast with your TV remote by using old HDMI-CEC technology. This just adds convenience over using your phone, tablet, or computer to exclusively control it.
author: boonboonpow

review: One of the best additions to my current entertainment setup.  Love being able to "throw" videos from my tablet or smartphone quickly onto my HDTV.  As I add new monitors in my home, this is a necessary addition to each of them.

review: When it works, it's great. The (huge) problem is finding iPad apps that work with it. So far, YouTube works 100% of the time, Comedy Central works about 1% of the time. Casting the iPad screen? Forget it! This seems to be much more versatile on an Android platform.
